ext_descriptions.ext_description: The schema_name constant specifies an upper case representation of the name of the present Express schema.

The coordinated_assembly_and_shape rule specifies that for a component and an assembly, related by a next_assembly_usage_occurrence, if their respective shapes have been specified and related with an instance of shape_representation_relationship, this shape_representation_relationship shall be related with the next_assembly_usage_occurrence with an instance context_dependent_shape_representation. This rule intends to constrain the assembly relationship and the placement information to be related, in order to identify for which occurrence of a component a particular position has been specified.
This rule calls the function assembly_shape_is_defined which returns true if the assembly relationship and shape relationship are explicitly related.
There shall not be any instance of next_assembly_usage_occurrence for which the assembly_shape_is_defined function returns the value FALSE.

The assembly_shape_is_defined function accepts a next_assembly_usage_occurrence as input and returns a boolean result.
The function returns TRUE if all the following conditions are met:
the shape is defined for the product_definition which is the related_product_definition and the shape is defined for the product_definition which is the relating_product_definition in the next_assembly_usage_occurrence, and
the two shapes are related through a shape_representation_relationship, and
the two relationships are related through a context_dependent_shape_representation.
The function also returns TRUE if the shape of the related_product_definition or of the relating_product_definition is not defined.
The function returns FALSE when the following conditions are met:
the shapes are defined for the related_product_definition and the relating_product_definition;
the shapes are related through a shape_representation_relationship, but
the next_assembly_usage_occurrence and the shape_representation_relationship are not explicitly related through any context_dependent_shape_representation.
The definition of this function is identical to its definition in ISO 10303-203:1994.
